enWisdom: Loss [of opportunity leads to] burning regrets
The fruit of loss [of opportunity] is regret
The return of an opportunity [that is lost] is far off and unlikely
In loss [of opportunity] there is regret and (or) blame

Wisdom: مَنْ قَعَدَ عَنِ الْفُرْصَةِ أَعْجَزَهُ الْفَوْتُ
enWisdom: One who lets an opportunity pass by is crippled by its loss

Wisdom: مَنْ أَخَّرَ الْفُرْصَةَ عَنْ وَقْتِهَا فَلْيَكُنْ عَلَى ثِقَةٍ مِنْ فَوْتِهَا
enWisdom: Whoever delays taking an opportunity at the right time, then let him be sure that he will lose it
How far is making amends [for something] from [its initial] loss!
There is no regret like loss [of an opportunity]

Wisdom: مِنَ الْخُرْقِ الْعَجَلَةُ قَبْلَ الْإِمْكَانِ وَالْأَنَاةُ بَعْدَ إِصَابَةِ الْفُرْصَةِ
enWisdom: It is from ineptness to make haste before [having] ability, and to act slowly after getting the opportunity

Wisdom: مِنَ الْخُرْقِ تَرْكُ الْفُرْصَةِ عِنْدَ الْإِمْكَانِ
enWisdom: It is from ineptitude to let go of an opportunity when one is able to take it
Hours are the lurking place of banes
